class.name: LevelListSelectionType
class.documentation: Users may supply a list of the contour levels to be plotted by setting the parameter CONTOUR_LEVEL_SELECTION_TYPE to 'LEVEL_LIST' and passing an array of contour level values. This method enables users to plot contours with irregular intervals.

parameter.name: contour_level_list
parameter.documentation: List of contour levels to be plotted
parameter.migration: New Magics: Parameter contour_level_list sent to new Magics[LevelListSelectionType].

class.name: IntervalSelectionType
class.documentation: If the parameter CONTOUR_LEVEL_SELECTION_TYPE is set to 'INTERVAL' , MAGICS will plot contours at regularly spaced intervals using the value of CONTOUR_REFERENCE_LEVEL as a base and the value in CONTOUR_INTERVAL as the interval between levels.

parameter.name: contour_reference_level
parameter.documentation: Contour level from which contour interval is calculated

parameter.name: contour_interval
parameter.documentation: Interval in data units between two contour lines

class.name: CountSelectionType
class.documentation: The number of contour levels may be set by the user by setting the parameter CONTOUR_LEVEL_SELECTION_TYPE to 'COUNT' (default) and CONTOUR_LEVEL_COUNT to the number of levels to be plotted. MAGICS will then calculate the contour interval and the user's plot will consist of the number of levels specified with a regular contour interval. This is the default method and the default number of levels is 10. The exact number of contour levels plotted may not be CONTOUR_LEVEL_COUNT as PCONT will always use the value stored in CONTOUR_REFERENCE_LEVEL as a starting point and will pick reasonable values for the contour interval.

parameter.name: contour_level_count
parameter.documentation: Count or number of levels to be plotted. Magics will try to find "nice levels", this means that the number of levels could be slightly different from the asked number of levels

parameter.name: contour_level_tolerance
parameter.documentation: Tolerance: Do not use nice levels if the number of levels is really to different [count +/- tolerance]

parameter.name: contour_reference_level
parameter.documentation: Contour level from which contour interval is calculated
